clinical_study.brief_title: IPICK Blocking for TKA With Moderate Flexion Contracture
clinical_study.official_title: IPICK Blocking for Extension Recovery in TKA With Preoperative Moderate Flexion Contracture

lead_sponsor.agency: The First Hospital of Jilin University

clinical_study.source: The First Hospital of Jilin University

brief_summary.textblock: Clinical effect of intermittent multiple IPICK blocking on TKA for knee osteoarthritis with flexion contracture between 5 ° and 10 °

detailed_description.textblock: From October 2020 to January 2021, 40 knee osteoarthritis patients with flexion contracture between 5 ° and 10 ° total knee arthroplasty are enrolled in this study. 20 patients are treated with Adductor Canal Block + Infiltration between the Popliteal Artery and Capsule of the Knee, and 20 patients are treated with Adductor Canal Block alone.

primary_outcome.description: Visual Analog Score for pain at rest, straightening, flexion at 45 ° and walking, the minimum and maximum values are 0 to 10, higher scores mean a worse outcome.
Visual Analog Score for pain at rest, straightening, flexion at 45 ° and walking, the minimum and maximum values are 0 to 10, higher scores mean a worse outcome.

secondary_outcome.description: total opioid consumption measured by milliliter.

secondary_outcome.description: numbness of the nerve related skin

secondary_outcome.time_frame: through hospitalization, an average of 7 days
secondary_outcome.description: number of cases whose Visual Analog Score for pain was more than 5

arm_group.description: The first 20 patients received Continue Adductor Canal Block + Infiltration between the Popliteal Artery and Capsule of the Knee
The second 20 patients received Continue Adductor Canal Block alone

intervention.description: continue adductor canal block plus Infiltration between the Popliteal Artery and Capsule of the Knee

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. The diagnosis was knee osteoarthritis
2. The flexion contracture was between 5 and 10 degrees
3. ASA grade I-III
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Lower extremity neuropathy.
2. Contraindications of nerve anesthesia or regional anesthesia.
3. unable to cooperate, allergic to the drugs used in this study.
4. Non steroidal anti-inflammatory drugs are not tolerated.
5. chronic opioid consumption (daily or almost daily use)

facility.name: The First Hospital of Jilin University
